results.doc_title: Research Roadmap & Project Tracking (GCI + IXI + USCI + GCX)
results.purpose: Tracks research projects and strategic initiatives across multiple brands (HelloFresh, Green Chef, Factor_) and markets, managing project status, ownership, timelines, and strategic alignment
key_data_points: 4 project statuses tracked: Requested, Planned, In Flight, Complete, Deprioritized
3 team flags: GCI-led, IXI-led, USCI-led, Prod Analytics-led
6 strategic anchors: Foundational Insights, Cultural Relevance, Consumer Closeness, Value Perception, Efficiency, Creative & Campaign Evaluation
Primary markets: United States, Canada, Sweden, Global
Multiple quarterly GCS (likely Global Customer Survey) reporting cycles tracked

entities.name: HelloFresh
entities.context: Primary brand with most projects across multiple markets

entities.name: Green Chef
entities.context: Brand with loyalty deep dive project completed

entities.name: Factor_
entities.context: Brand included in customer closeness campaigns and GCS reporting

entities.name: Bassem Elhelaly
entities.context: Driver for majority of GCI-led projects including consumer closeness and GCS reporting

entities.name: Joanna Lindenberg
entities.context: Approver for most GCI-led projects

entities.name: Marc
entities.context: Approver for IXI-led projects, consulted on GCS revamp

entities.name: Patrick Roney
entities.context: Approver for US-focused projects including Green Chef and XXL Menu

entities.name: Annette MvdE
entities.context: Driver for Influencer Marketplace strategy project

entities.name: GCS (Global Customer Survey)
entities.context: Quarterly tracking survey being revamped for 2026

entities.name: Influencer Marketplace
entities.context: Strategic project to create 'Shopify for Food' platform

entities.name: Customer Closeness Campaign
entities.context: Weekly drop-in sessions for employees to hear from customers

entities.name: XXL Menu
entities.context: Post-launch analysis planned for US market

insights: GCI-led projects dominate the roadmap, indicating centralized research operations
Strong focus on 'Consumer Closeness' with multiple ongoing campaigns across brands
Several 'Foundational Insights' projects are deprioritized or only requested, suggesting resource constraints
Quarterly GCS reporting is a consistent operational rhythm (Q1-Q4 tracked)
Value Perception (#1) and Menu Expansion (#2) are numbered strategic priorities
Multiple projects lack assigned drivers/approvers, particularly requested and deprioritized items
Global scope projects outnumber market-specific initiatives
2026 planning is underway with GCS revamp and peak campaign preparations
Cross-functional collaboration evident with multiple stakeholders consulted/informed per project
Customer loyalty and retention are recurring themes across multiple strategic anchors

insights: Most projects (9 out of 11) are already in production, indicating mature development cycles
Strong focus on personalization features (menu personalization, ad progression, merchandising widgets)
Infrastructure and automation improvements are key themes (Databricks, multi-region deployment, bulk upload)
Multiple mega alliances collaborate across projects, showing cross-functional organization
GitHub repositories are primary documentation source for technical projects
Growth Alliance is involved in multiple customer-facing initiatives
Menu Search feature has been successfully tested and rolled out to multiple markets (CK, CA, US)
Data platform modernization is underway with Unity Catalog and Databricks automation
Developer experience improvements are prioritized (FreshChat integration into Hellodev)
Most sessions have HM follow-up marked with 'x', suggesting active tracking and accountability

results.purpose: Tracks cumulative conversion rate (CR) improvements from experiments and rollouts for New Ventures TPT (presumably a product/team) in 2025
key_data_points: Free items in order summary rollout: 24.19% CR improvement
Two Step loading experiment: 0.90% CR improvement
Total tracked improvements: 25.09% from completed initiatives

entities.name: New Ventures TPT
entities.context: Main team/product being tracked for conversion rate improvements

entities.name: Statsig
entities.context: Analytics/experimentation platform used for tracking experiment results

entities.name: Free items in the order summary
entities.context: Completed rollout contributing 24.19% CR improvement - largest contributor

entities.name: Two Step loading experiment
entities.context: Completed experiment contributing 0.90% CR improvement

insights: Target already exceeded: Current performance at 25.09% vs 20% target (125% of goal achieved)
Single initiative dominance: 'Free items in order summary' accounts for ~96% of total improvements
Pipeline visibility: Multiple initiatives in progress (fresh recipes, air dried cadence, allergies funnel) with results pending
Mix of approaches: Using both experiments (testing) and rollouts (full deployment) to drive improvements
Strong early performance: Only 2 of 7+ initiatives have reported results, suggesting significant runway remaining

results.doc_title: Research Roadmap & Project Tracking (GCI + IXI + USCI + GCX)
results.purpose: Tracks research projects and strategic initiatives across multiple brands (HelloFresh, Green Chef, Factor_) and markets, managing project status, ownership, timelines, and strategic alignment
key_data_points: 4 project statuses tracked: Requested, Planned, In Flight, Complete, Deprioritized
3 team flags: GCI-led, IXI-led, USCI-led, Prod Analytics-led
6 strategic anchors: Foundational Insights, Cultural Relevance, Consumer Closeness, Value Perception, Efficiency, Creative & Campaign Evaluation
Primary markets: United States, Canada, Sweden, Global
Multiple completed projects (GCS Reporting Q1-Q3, Customer Safari Sweden, Free For Life recommendations)

entities.context: Primary brand with most projects across all markets

entities.name: Green Chef
entities.context: Secondary brand with loyalty deep dive project

entities.context: Brand included in GCS reporting and customer closeness campaigns

insights: GCI-led projects dominate the roadmap, indicating centralized research operations
Strong focus on 'Consumer Closeness' with multiple ongoing customer listening initiatives
Several 'Foundational Insights' projects remain in 'Requested' or 'Deprioritized' status, suggesting resource constraints or strategic pivots
Value Perception (#1) is a recurring strategic anchor across multiple projects
Global Customer Survey (GCS) is a core tracking mechanism with quarterly reporting cadence
US market has the most dedicated projects, followed by global initiatives
Multiple projects lack completion dates or are marked as 'Requested', indicating an ambitious backlog
Key strategic questions remain unanswered: category entry points, new verticals to explore, localization needs, and churn analysis
Cross-functional collaboration is evident with multiple stakeholders (Consulted/Informed) per project
2026 planning is underway with GCS revamp and menu expansion analysis scheduled

entities.name: The Pets Table

insights: This is an early version (v1) of a business plan, suggesting it may be subject to revisions
Marked as internal, indicating confidential strategic planning information
The 2026 timeframe suggests forward-looking financial and operational planning
The 'BP' designation indicates this is a formal business plan document

results.purpose: Pet food subscription pricing strategy and model for different product plans (Fresh, Mixed, Topper, Dry, Air Dried) with competitive benchmarking and margin optimization
key_data_points: Max freezer fill: 1/3 of small NYC apartment freezer
Fresh plan: Match TFD prices (excluding shipping)
Topper plan: 55-62.5% of Fresh price for 50% of product
PC2 margins and ROI are key performance metrics

entities.name: TFD (The Farmer's Dog)
entities.context: Primary competitor benchmark for Fresh plan pricing

entities.name: Ollie
entities.context: Competitor for Fresh plan pricing comparison

entities.name: Pantry Fresh
entities.context: Competitor consideration for Mixed plan positioning

entities.name: TPT
entities.context: Company developing this pricing model (likely The Pet Table or similar)

insights: Pricing strategy uses Fresh plan as anchor/headline price with other plans positioned relative to it
Company prioritizes consistent pricing for same quantity of product across SKUs
Six-step pricing methodology: import costs → benchmark competitors → create scenarios → smooth pricing → check margins → create price steps
Strategic focus on larger dogs due to higher ROI potential
Price testing agenda focuses on three areas: architecture issues (internal consistency), competitor positioning, and customer segment optimization
Shipping is charged separately but waived for first order as acquisition strategy
Price per pound generally decreases with higher calorie/quantity tiers within same plan

results.purpose: Tracks marketing test campaigns and A/B tests for Good Chop across different channels (SEM, Facebook, CRM, Direct Mail) with various promotional offers
key_data_points: Campaign naming convention: Quarter [Channel] Offer A __ Offer B
Product offers: Ground Beef, Ribeyes, Welcome Kits (A & B), Wings, Choose Your Protein/Meat/Steak
Last modified dates ranging from 2024 to 2025

entities.name: Good Chop
entities.context: Meat subscription/delivery service running marketing tests

entities.name: kelly.abrams@goodchop.com
entities.context: Owner of SEM (Search Engine Marketing) campaign tests - both New Business (NB), Competitor (Comp), and Brand campaigns

entities.name: yukie.yamamoto@goodchop.com
entities.context: Owner of Facebook (FB) campaign tests

entities.name: yt@hellofresh.com
entities.context: Owner of CRM and Direct Mail (DM) campaign tests; HelloFresh email suggests parent company relationship

entities.name: SEM (Search Engine Marketing)
entities.context: Marketing channel with NB (New Business), Comp (Competitor), and Brand subcategories

entities.name: FB (Facebook)
entities.context: Social media advertising channel

entities.name: CRM
entities.context: Customer Relationship Management/email marketing channel, includes CA (Canada) variants

entities.name: DM (Direct Mail)
entities.context: Physical mail marketing channel

insights: Good Chop appears to be owned by or affiliated with HelloFresh (based on yt@hellofresh.com email)
Tests follow A/B or multi-variant format (indicated by __ separator and [3] for three-way tests)
Clear channel ownership: Kelly manages SEM, Yukie manages Facebook, YT manages CRM/DM
Promotional strategy evolved from simpler $120-$150 offers in 2023 to more complex product-specific offers (Ground Beef, Ribeyes, Welcome Kits) in 2025
Discount structures use multi-tier patterns, likely representing sequential order discounts (e.g., 50-30-20 = $50 off order 1, $30 off order 2, $20 off order 3)
Geographic expansion evident with CA (Canada) specific tests appearing in 2023
SEM strategy segments by audience: New Business (NB), Competitor (Comp), and Brand campaigns
Recent 2025 tests focus heavily on 'Choose Your Offer' flexibility and Welcome Kit bundles
One test references 'Tariff-Proof Copy' suggesting response to economic/trade conditions
Most recent activity concentrated in Q2-Q3 2025 with last modified dates in June-July 2025

results.purpose: Track and manage trial box subscription resets for TPT (pet food) customers in KN (Kenya) market who experienced payment failures, and cancel subscriptions after 5+ failed attempts
key_data_points: Reset timeframe: 4 weeks maximum before cancellation

entities.name: TPT
entities.context: Pet food product line with trial box offering for new customers

entities.name: New Ventures Tech team
entities.context: Engineering team responsible for manually resetting subscriptions back to trial SKU

entities.name: #squad-nv-pet-food
entities.context: Slack channel for submitting reset requests to engineers

entities.name: BOB (Back Office Backend)
entities.context: Tool used for bulk subscription cancellations and management

entities.name: Databricks
entities.context: Data platform where queries are executed against payments_hf and other databases

insights: Two-tier process: subscriptions with 5+ failed payments are canceled immediately, while those with fewer failures are reset to trial status
Bi-weekly schedule: Tuesday runs cover Saturday-Tuesday deliveries, Friday runs cover Wednesday-Friday deliveries
Trial boxes are smaller and lower-priced than regular boxes, requiring special handling to honor promotional pricing
Process prevents indefinite order creation for failed payments by enforcing 4-week maximum reset period
Uses multiple data sources (f_orders, sales_order_item, subscription tables) to identify eligible subscriptions
Filters ensure only unshipped trial boxes with payment errors for new customers (loyalty=0) are processed
Manual engineering intervention required for resets, indicating no automated solution currently exists
